document.heading: Department of Corrections Criminal Background Investigation Authorization Act of 1998

history.narrative: Law 12-126, the “Department of Corrections Criminal Background Investigation Authorization Act of 1998,” was introduced in Council and assigned Bill No. 12-029, which was referred to the Committee on the Judiciary. The Bill was adopted on first and second readings on December 4, 1997, and January 6, 1998, respectively. Signed by the Mayor on January 26, 1998, it was assigned Act No. 12-260 and transmitted to both Houses of Congress for its review. D.C. Law 12-126 became effective on June 19, 1998.
